list1: ElCruzo was born!
Elected Head Boy in 5th Grade (similar to Student Government President).
list2: Represented my school at an Annual Student Leadership Initiative Summit (SMI).
list3: Wrote the Common Entrance Examination (final elementary school exam) with one of the best results in my school.

list1: Chosen to represent my school at the national math competition, Cowbellpedia.
list2: Took my middle school final exams and graduated as the 2nd-best overall student.
list3: Developed a keen interest in art and painted my friend in under an hour while he stood still.
list4: Enrolled in soccer practice within my neighborhood & participating in communtiy sessions and sports.

list1: Earned the role of school prefect during my freshman year of high school, a position typically reserved for Juniors and Seniors.
list2: Led an initiative to mobilize volunteers and prominent school alumni, successfully raising up to ₦100,000 for a charitable donation to a local orphanage near my school.

header: Dived in to the world of coding!
list1: Learned the syntax of Python for the 1st time, marking the beginning of my programming journey.
list2: Developed my 1st program (a TicTacToe game) with Python.
list3: Developed various games using Python, including Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simon Says, Hangman, and more. Check out the code for Rock-Paper-Scissors, the game for Simon Says, and the Hangman game along with other games on my GitHub.

list1: Began learning web development with HTML & CSS, thanks to W3Schools.
list2: Delved deeper into web development, acquiring proficiency in Bootstrap and SCSS syntax.
list3: Joined the school team for 6-Aside, an inter-school soccer tournament held biennially.

header: Dived in to the world of 3D Animation!
list1: Joined the Blender Community.
list2: Made my first 3D-Model using Blender 3D.
list3: Created a basic cartoon clip commercial for a friend's business using Blender.

list1: Explored various programming languages, including C++, Java, SQL, and PHP.
list2: Refreshed my knowledge of Python syntax because I was getting rusty, Then I went further with the Django framework.
list3: Joined and became a core contributor of the OpenSource Community Africa (OSCA), a community of developers.

header: Dived in to the world of Cyber Security & Penetration Testing
list1: Installed and experimented with the Linux Operating System for the 1st time, specifically Kali, for educational purposes.
list2: Expanded my online presence, connecting with communities of individuals who continue to inspire me to this day.
list3: Elected as the Senior Prefect Boy, serving as the head of the Student Body in high school.

list1: Chosen to represent my high school at the National Association of Private Proprietors (NAPPS) Science Fair, a regional science competition for private high schools.
list2: Engineered a fully autonomous Obstacle-Avoidance Robot using Arduino, a C++ framework. This project, based on my understanding of sound wave propagation principles, secured an impressive 3rd runner-up position among 600+ participants. Access the code here.

list1: Became a member of the Sololearn Nigeria Community.
list2: Started learning ReactJS and explored NodeJS.
list3: Participated in various tech conferences, seminars, and career-building workshops.
list4: Served as the STEM President of my school after the Science Fair Competition

header: Graduated from High School at age 16
list1: Took my senior year exams in high school.
list2: Graduated as one of the best students with all As and got the overall best performance in the Unified Tertiary Matriculation Examination.
list3: Received a cash prize of ₦120,000 from school alumni for being the best graduating student in ICT, among other awards.

list1: Explored Cryptocurrency & Blockchain
list2: Authored articles on Dev.to and Forem while actively contributing to open-source projects.
list3: Teamed up with a fellow developer to create CipherScape, an automated cryptocurrency bot for trading backtesting, algorithms, and EA systems.

header: Dived into the world of ML & AI
list1: Discovered a passion for Artificial Intelligence, took online courses on Machine & Deep Learning, and worked with Tableau and Power BI.
list2: Collaborated with friends to research and explore the integration of Generative AI APIs into apps. Due to the intensive nature of the work, I took a coding break.

list1: Embarked on another language learning rush by picking up VueJS and NextJS, and engaged in projects utilizing Heroku, Vercel, cPanel, MongoDB, MySQL, AWS, and Google Suite.
list2: Tried to create a REST API for the 1st time.

list1: Currently participating in a Software Engineering internship at Zuri Team, Inc.
list2: Created CipherScape v1.0.1 ~ a Telegram bot offering real-time stock data. Through integration of additional commands for diverse stock information, CipherScape garnered over 200 users shortly after launch.

header: Got my first gig from tech!
list1: Secured a significant role as the Lead Backend Developer, with some involvement in Frontend development, for Thrida.
list2: Contracted to develop a fully-fledged virtual cryptocurrency trading web application, designed to execute trading logic and function as a cryptocurrency wallet.

list1: Received nearly 15 admission decisions from prestigious colleges and universities in the United States, accompanied by substantial scholarship offers totaling at least $90,000 per year, renewable for four years.
list2: Committed to Howard University to pursue a major in Electrical Engineering and a minor in Computer Science starting from the Fall 2023 semester.

list1: Collaborated with other developers on a contract basis to build a platform for the education academy Afrelib, making very little contribution to the codebase.
list2: Travelled to the US with my parents and siblings.
list3: Drove a car for the 1st time.
list4: Began learning Spanish Language, thanks to Duolingo.

list1: Remotely interned with Adcar Technology, LLC, a tech consulting firm based in Chicago, IL, serving as a Volunteer Software Engineer.
list2: Participated in a virtual internship program with HBCU First, powered by Indeed.

list1: Developed ShopGenius, a web scraper tailored to collect user reviews, ratings, and product information from e-commerce websites such as Amazon, offering personalized recommendations to users.
Got accepted into the Paragon One x PwC Nonprofit Consulting and World Learning Inc. Fundraising Communication Strategy Remote Externship program.
Learned Recursion, Time, and Space Complexities in Data Structures & Algorithms with AlgoExpert.
list2: Admitted into Codepath's Cybersecurity course for Fall 2023.

list1: Participated in the HP FOWA Future Tech Innovation Incubator Conference.
list2: Visited North Carolina for the 1st time!
list3: Enrolled in the Computational Science and Engineering Course CSE.0002x sponsored by MIT.

list1: Successfully concluded the internship program at HBCU First and shared a post about it on LinkedIn. Check out the post here.
list2: Accepted into ITSMF, the Information Technology Senior Management Forum, a mentoring program and development organization dedicated to increasing young Black professionals in Technology.

list1: Participated in the Howard University annual Day of Service (HUDOS).
list2: Assumed an executive board position at the Howard University Nigerian Students Organization (HUNSO) as a Freshman Liaison.
list3: Contributed to the assembly of an autonomous robot with advanced features, showcased at a Robotics Event at Howard University.

list1: Took on an E-board position at the Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE), Howard Chapter, as the Freshman Liaison for the 2023-2024 school year.
list2: My team, consisting of Joseph Musenge and Ka'Pri Burden, emerged as the winners of the 2023 HP FOWA Innovation Challenge.

list1: Attended ColorStack's Stacked Up Summit.
list2: Attended a virtual panel discussion titled 'Black Excellence: Celebrating Achievements and Inspiring Change'.
list3: Accepted an invitation to join the Talent Community at Wells Fargo.
list4: Welcomed into the Gilead Early Talent Initiative.

list1: Selected as one of the 15 students to join the esteemed inSTEM Program at Howard, sponsored by the National Science and Technology Medals Foundation.
list2: Completed the PwC and Paragon One Non-Profit Consulting and Fundraising Communication Strategy Remote Externship.

list1: Represented Howard University at the HackHarvard Hackathon at Harvard, where my team, James Fei-Baffoe, Candice Hines, Nia Anderson, and I came up with a groundbreaking project that will potentially reduce misdiagnosis in the healthcare industry by over 20%.
Invited to be an ambassador for Paragon One.
list2: Successfully completed CodePath's Intro To Cybersecurity course. Find the certificate here.
list3: Invited to attend the Evercore Diversity Seminar in Washington, D.C.

header: Participated in a lot of Competitions
list1: Went to lunch with the Grad Dean of UCI and explored potential research opportunities at a UC School.
list2: Competed in Deloitte's Risk & Financial Advisory-Cyber Threat Competition.
list3: Participated in the AT&T HBCU Innovation Challenge alongside students from HBCUs nationwide.

list1: Accepted an ambassadorial role at Epic Hire, Inc. at my university and beyond.
list2: Achieved an outstanding 4.0/4.0 GPA, concluding my first semester of college on a high note.

list1: Secured a Meta internship post-birthday, excited to contribute to their dynamic team.
Honored to be named to the Dean's List in the College of Engineering and Architecture.

list1: Got into an Undergraduate Research Program at Howard University's Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning Consortium to Advance Health Equity and Researcher Diversity.
